definition: ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
ice breaker/same as 冰船[bing1 chuan2]

sentences.english: The atomic icebreaker reeved the icebergs.
sentences.chinese: 原子破冰船穿过冰山之间向前航行。

sentences.english: Icebreaker ‘Krasin’ is a museum that could be visited during the Festival of Modern art held in a traditional museum.
sentences.chinese: 人们可以在现代艺术节期间参观破冰船“卡拉辛”号。

sentences.english: I heard that the government sends some icebreakers to settle the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我听说是政府派遣破冰船来解决问题。

sentences.english: I will protect you and break open the crowds in your way like an ice-breaker in arctic sea.
sentences.chinese: 我要护著妳，拨开挡路的人群如破冰船行在北极冰洋。

sentences.english: I start to draw my bow into stern notch of ice-breaker.
sentences.chinese: 把我船头拉入破冰船船尾凹部。

sentences.english: Ann: I heard that the government sends some icebreakers to settle the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我听说是政府派遣破冰船来解决问题。

sentences.english: The icebreaker symbolizes a whole epoch in the history of Russia.
sentences.chinese: 破冰船是俄罗斯历史上整整一个时代的象征。

sentences.english: For their critics, Russia's fleet of icebreakers are hastening exploitation of the Arctic.
sentences.chinese: 评论家们来说，俄罗斯的破冰船队正在加紧开发北极。
破冰船“纳特可利克”号将给你护航。

sentences.english: Keiichi Hori is captain of the icebreaker "Aurora".
sentences.chinese: 堀圭一是欧若拉冰船的船长。

sentences.english: The bad weather forced an icebreaking ship in the Dutch port of Rotterdam into service for the first time in 12 years.
sentences.chinese: 荷兰鹿特丹港则在12年来首次动用了破冰船来除冰。
